intro: Gochnatia discolor, commonly known as the white gochnatia, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with white markings, and it produces small, woody fruits called cypsela. Gochnatia discolor is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native region.
